chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Carlos Montiel was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case recalled at 3:32pm.  Clerk - CRHI. 
Defendant Carlos  Montiel in court with attorney Svehlek (appearing for attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.)  Defendant Carlos  Montiel in custody.  Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews case history, status and filings.  Court reviews documents submitted to the Court by the Defense. 
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed.
Plea of "NO CONTEST  " entered on Count #1; factual basis given and stipulated; the Court finds this charge to be a 6th offense; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2 and Count #3.
Arguments presented by Counsel.
Statement presented by the Defendant. 

On Count #1, the Court sentences the Defendant: 
The Court sentences the defendant to 4 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years.  This sentence is consecutive to the sentence now being in served.  
The Court finds that the defendant is entitled to credit for sentence credit for time served from the date of violation until reconfinement.  The Court will sign a stip if submitted by counsel or continue the case for further hearing to address the issue further if a stipulation can not be reached.  The Court gives counsel 3 weeks to submit a proposed stipulation or letter briefs on the narrow issue of sentence credit. 

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--To pay a fine of $600 plus costs/fees/surcharges totaling $1519
--$56.74 blood testing costs to the Wisconsin State Patrol.
--$250 DNA surcharge and sample compliance. 
--Absolute sobriety.
--No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid d.l. and Agent approval. 
--No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores. Except as may be allowed by the Extended Supervision Agent for employment purposes.  
--AODA and follow-through with recommended treatment per the Agent. 

The Court also orders:
--Revocation of drivers license for 36 months.
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 36 month period. 
--6 demerit points assessed.

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given.
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant.
Recess 4:21pm

NEXT - The Court gives counsel 3 weeks to submit a proposed stipulation or letter briefs on the narrow issue of sentence credit.

Defendant Carlos  Montiel in court with Attorney Svehlek (appearing for Atty. Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.)  Defendant Carlos  Montiel in custody.  Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews case history, status and filings.  Noting that Atty. De La Rosa was called away related to an emergency.
Atty. Svehlek requests some additional time to prepare for Plea Hearing with Sentencing being scheduled at a later date. 
Court will recall the case at 3:30pm.

for continuance is granted

Case called at 1:48 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Carlos Montiel appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa (PD will appoint counsel). Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Service of Complaint admitted; DOB & address confirmed accurate for Def.; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Court finds probable cause within the complaint

Court requires a $3000 CASH bond, with conditions: 
-  Defendant to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  Defendant to report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse on the first Monday or Thursday following release from custody at 1:00 pm, whichever comes sooner. If no one is available at that time, must report to the Clerk of Court's Office to make an appointment for installation.
-  No alcohol possession or ingestion. 
-  No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores. 
-  No operation of a motor vehicle without valid DL
